meanings.definition: Damage the reputation of (someone) by false accusations.
meanings.sent1: She defamed her classmate by spreading lies about her.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity was defamed by tabloid newspapers.
meanings.sent3: The gossip magazines defamed the alien with outrageous stories.
meanings.sent4: His actions defamed the honor of his family.
meanings.sent5: The false accusations defamed her character beyond repair.

meanings.sent1: The lawsuit was based on a case of defamation.
meanings.sent2: He was a victim of defamation in the media.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about defamation.
meanings.sent4: The power of social media can lead to quick defamation of character.
meanings.sent5: The company faced a lawsuit for defamation of a competitor.
